title: Actividad citotóxica de extractos etanólicos de hojas y tallos de Lippia graveolens HBK contra la línea celular de cáncer de pulmón SK-LU-1
author: María Estela Frías-Zepeda; Jorge Ibarra-Berumen; Cynthia Ordaz-Pichardo; Martha Rosales-Castro
sitename: El Portal de Investigadores del Instituto Politécnico Nacional
cleaned_text: Actividad citotóxica de extractos etanólicos de hojas y tallos de Lippia graveolens HBK contra la línea celular de cáncer de pulmón SK-LU-1 AU - Frías-Zepeda, María economic in Mexico, known as oregano. The leaves are used as condiments, and people use this species for respiratory and digestive disorders. The aim of this cytotoxic effect of ethanolic extracts obtained 300 µg/mL were used and HFF-1 as normal control and extracts, showed cytotoxic effect, although stem was stronger than damage to normal cell control. The phenolic compounds caffeic acid cytotoxic activity, and have a wide possibility of use lung cancer treatment. AB - Lippia graveolens HBK (Verbenaceae) is an herb of economic in Mexico, known as oregano. The leaves are used as condiments, and people use this species for respiratory and digestive disorders. The aim of this cytotoxic effect of ethanolic extracts obtained 300 µg/mL were used and HFF-1 as normal control and extracts, showed cytotoxic effect, although stem was stronger than damage to normal cell control. The phenolic compounds caffeic acid cytotoxic activity, and have a wide possibility of use in lung cancer treatment.
